abstract: An article last Sunday about immigration policies that are hindering efforts by technology companies to hire foreign-born engineers misstated the birthplace of Jerry Yang, co-founder of Yahoo. He was born in Taiwan, not China. The article also misstated the Hungarian-born Andrew S. Grove’s role in the start-up of the Intel Corporation. He was brought in by Robert N. Noyce and Gordon E. Moore to operate the company at its founding in 1968; he was not a co-founder.

lead_paragraph: An article last Sunday about immigration policies that are hindering efforts by technology companies to hire foreign-born engineers misstated the birthplace of Jerry Yang, co-founder of Yahoo. He was born in Taiwan, not China. The article also misstated the Hungarian-born Andrew S. Grove’s role in the start-up of the Intel Corporation. He was brought in by Robert N. Noyce and Gordon E. Moore to operate the company at its founding in 1968; he was not a co-founder.
